@simon_on_energy @SiemensGamesa They're shipped out to site fully assembled. The ships that take them look very odd when fully laden with towers on the deck and blades laid horizontally. Gives them a beam of about 60m!

@steverico @simon_on_energy @SiemensGamesa Those stilts are called spud legs. There are large pockets of stone on the river bed to ensure it remains stable during lifting ops. The land based crane builds the towers full height before the jack up vessel takes over and loads itself. It takes 4 towers inc blades & nacelles
